title: Karl Marx : a reader
subject: Marx, Karl, 1818-1883
Communisme
Marxisme
communism
Marxism
Communism
creator: Marx, Karl, 1818-1883.$$QMarx, Karl
publisher: Cambridge Cambridgeshire ; New York, NY : Press Syndicate of the University of Cambridge
description: This volume contains a selection of Karl Marx's most important writings, organized thematically under eight headings: methodology, alienation, economics, exploitation, historical materialism, classes, politics, and ideology. Jon Elster provides a brief introduction to each selection to explain its context and its place in Marx's argument. The volume is designed as a companion to Elster's An Introduction to Karl Marx and the thematic structure of each book is the same. But the Reader can also stand on its own and offers the student a substantial and revealingly organized selection of the crucial texts needed to understand and assess Marx's views.
contents: I. Marxist methodology. 1. Introduction to the Grundrisse. 2. Theses on Feuerbach. 3. From 'The German Ideology' -- II. Alienation. 4. From 'Comments on James Mill'. 5. From 'The Economic and philosophical manuscripts of 1844'. 6. From the 'Grundrisse'. 7. From 'Capital I'. -- III. Marxian economics. 8. From 'Capital I'. 9. From 'Capital III'. -- IV. Exploitation. 10. From 'The German ideology'. 11. From 'Results of the Immediate Process of Production. 12. From 'Capital I'. 13. From 'Critique of the Gotha Programme' -- V. Historical Materialism. 14. From 'The German Ideology'. 15. From 'Preface to 'A Critique of Political Economy' 16. From the 'Grundrisse'. 17. From 'Capital I' 18. From 'Capital III'. -- VI. Class consciousness and Class struggle. 19. From 'The Communist Manifesto'. 20. From the 'Newspaper articles on England'. -- 21. From 'The Class Struggles in France'. 22. From 'The Eighteenth Brumaire of Louis Bonaparte. 23. From "Capital III". -- VII. Marx's theory of politics. 24. From 'The Communist Manifesto'. 25. Address to the Central Committee of the Communist League. 26. From 'The Eighteenth Brumaire of Louis Bonaparte. 27. From 'The Civil War in France'. 28. From 'Critique of the Gotha Programme. 29. From the 'Comments on Bakunin' -- VIII. Marxist Critique of Ideology. 30. From 'Contribution to the Critique of Hegel's Philosophy of Law. Introduction. 31. From 'The German Ideology'. 32. From 'The Eighteenth Brumaire of Louis Bonaparte'. 33. From 'Theories of Surplus-Value.
